Description: Cypriot style limestone carving of a woman standing. Body and left hand only. Soft Limestone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

'T' written on back, though rest is unclear. Other examples marked T (AΠ) all specifically label pieces from stratum within the Temple of for Apollo. Part of a small group of archaising Hellenistic or Classical Cypriot limestone figures brought to Naukratis (British Museum GR1900,0214.22; Amsterdam, Allard Pierson Museum 7835; Champaign, Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois 1926.02.0032; 1926.02.0029; Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.3.1899 Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1886.457; AN1896-1908-G.1042; Bristol, City Art Gallery & Museum H446.c). Naukratis parallel previously dated as 'probably archaizing work of late Hellenistic date or slightly later' (Budde & Nicholls 1967, no. 77/80, pl. 26). Close parallels from Golgoi dated end 5th and early 4th century BC that also show a tambour held under the left hand, whilst holding an offering, here a flower (Hermary 1989, 371, 372-3, nos 750, 754, 756). Budde, L. and Nicholls, R. 1967. Catalogue of the Greek and Roman sculpture in the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.137) (Phase 3)
